name: Killarney Plaza Hotel and Spa

reviews.text: We stayed two nights in the Killarney Plaza and had a great time. The hotel is excellent and is in a great location.
reviews.title: Wow great stay at the Killarney Plaza
One of my favorite places in Ireland
reviews.text: During the day we toured the Ring of Kerry and then came back to the hotel for a great dinner and a few drinks in the piano bar. Then we went out and had a nice walk around town to cap off the night.

reviews.title: Gorgeous Hotel
reviews.text: The rooms were nice and the staff were friendly. What more can you ask for?
I highly recommend staying here when you visit Killarney and we'd definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Disappointed - noise and parking

reviews.text: My husband and I visited for one night in early November 2007and had a fabulous stay. Yes, it is not the cheapest place to stay in Killarney but both of us love spas, and the Molton Brown Spa is not to be missed! I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

likes.liked: — everything! but the Molten Brown toiletries rocked, the staff was great also

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff here were snobbish and superior (with the exception of the porter). We were made to feel like an irritation, and even the simplest of requests treated with indifference and sometimes rudeness. A conveyor belt of a hotel with zero hospitality.
reviews.title: Hospitality NOT a strong point

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Killarney Plaza for 3 nights from 21st August 07, the hotel is in the best location in Town, just yards from Shops, Bars, Restaurants etc. We stayed in executive room 116, this was a complimentary upgrade which we were delighted to receive at check-in, it had a very comfortable bed, good bathroom with powerful shower, tea & coffee hospitality tray, satellite tv, free wireless internet connection in the room for your laptop. We had dinner in the Petrus Restaurant on one night and this was superb great value at 45euros per person for 3 courses, the buffet breakfast offered a fantastic choice of hot and cold meals, something for everyone.. The leisure centre had a very nice indoor swimming pool in a very calming environment, jacquzzi, saunas and steam rooms were also available and all complimentary, spa treatments and a gym was also available but we did not use these. The hotel offers complimentary car parking in the secure basement area of the hotel for the duration of your stay, a hire car is definitely recommended to enjoy this most beautiful part of Ireland. For best hotel room rates contact the hotel directly on telephone number [-], we got a rate of 310euros which was per person for a 3 night stay and included full Irish Breakast each morning and Dinner on one evening. We will definitely return to the Killarney Plaza, choosing another hotel simply is not an option! When in Killarney you must eat at the great "Cooperage Restaurant" located just off the high street and about a 5 minute walk from the hotel door, you must also visit the most picturesque fishing village of Dingle just 40 miles away, enroute to Dingle stop by the beach area in the town of Inch, it is most beautiful. Book your trip now to the Killarney Plaza and you will not be disappointed, we will return very soon, can't wait!
reviews.title: Best location in Killarney, simply five star, superb!

likes.liked: — Location directly in the town cente
likes.disliked: — Finding the entrance to the hotel car park, its at the back of the hotel through a public car park.

reviews.text: This hotel has many advantages. It is beautiful, the rooms are comfortable, food was delicious, close to lots of shopping and pubs. Killarney is a beautiful part of Ireland.
reviews.title: Poor manners
Wonderful hotel
reviews.text: My only complaint about this hotel was the staff. Not that many did not speak English--that is the norm these days in Ireland. But rather the desk clerks and head waiters who gave the impression they'd rather not see us come in the door. They refused some of our simple requests . . . .really would rather that we not use the computer in the lobby put there for our use. I am sure there have been Americans before me who had been rude to the staff, but I personally tried to be very pleasant and reasonable. Frankly, I resented being treated like a naughty child or insufferable princess.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here as part of a 15 day trip with CIE Tours. This hotel was fantastic. It was beautiful inside with nice decorative artwork and a pool/fitness room. The rooms were neat and clean and the staff was friendly. The food was good as well. It is within walking distance to Killarney National Park and a lot of shopping. Also, horse drawn carriage rides can be found right outside the hotel. It is in a happening place. I enjoyed a cycling race sponsored by Powerade that went right past the hotel. Overall it was a great hotel in the heart of town. i would definately stay there again!!
reviews.title: Incomparable in Killarney

likes.liked: — A true four-star hotel, excellent location, accommodations, food and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 lovely nights - pool and gym were very good - Dinner was verygood (Breakfast not great). The rooms need to be modernised for the price (no interactive TV, etc..)
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall would recommend if you can get this hotel at the right price
reviews.title: Very nice luxury hotel with grat bars and public areas.

likes.liked: — The spectaular decor of the hotel

reviews.text: We arrived late at night at this superb hotel and negotiated a 3 night stay at a very reasonable price. The hotel is luxurious and there were many US couples on holidays with children and lots of company men having golfing holidays. The indoor swimming pool is spectacular, the bars and restaurants were also very good. The buffet breakfast is also delicious with a huge variety of food. The lamb and bacon in Ireland is indeed some of the best I have ever eaten.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel. Great Value for Money

reviews.text: We had parking within the hotel. It was the most difficult car park to negotiate however we managed to squeeze in. The floor where we parked our car did not have a direct lift to the reception. You had to drag your case up about 6 steps to the lift. Unusual - but there was help.
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel

reviews.text: Killarney is quite small and the hotel location is very central.
reviews.title: Hotel scented with lillies !!

likes.liked: — Lovely decoration, clean, good food and drink, lovely pool

reviews.text: I wouldn't book a hotel reservation without referring to trip advisor and Killarney Plaza rated highly, so made my shortlist.
reviews.title: I can see what the fuss is about

likes.liked: — friendly staff, great location, great breakfast and a top pint of Guinness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a bit of haggling over price we struck a deal and ten of us turned up on a hiking expedition.
reviews.title: Dissapointing customer services

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel decor is designed for its core clientele of middle-aged Americans visiting the auld sod, so it wasn't to our taste (urban sophisticates, all). But hey, the service? Fantastic.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

likes.disliked: — Steps up from the car park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Polite, efficient, well-groomed and nothing too much trouble. Hardly an Irishman among 'em, mind, but that's Ireland for you these days.
reviews.title: Visited Many Times, This Hotel Is The Business

reviews.text: Anyway, who cares: the people who run this hotel are exemplary and I can't praise it highly enough. And the breakfast was knockout (apart from the black pudding, which was disappointingly dry).
reviews.title: Won't disappoint you.....

likes.liked: — The comfortable bedroom, food and service
likes.disliked: — Nothing - just our disappointing visit to Gaby's restaurant

description: The 4-star Killarney Plaza Hotel reigns over Killarney Town with grace and glamour. Located adjacent to Killarney National Park and the gateway to the Ring of Kerry the hotel offers stylish bedrooms, superb restaurants, bars, conference and banquet facilities and the exclusive Molton Brown Spa.
